modules.description: This module defines the core data types used to represent users, teams, and notes when interacting with the HackMD API. It includes structured types for user and team metadata, note summaries, and full note details, along with permission settings for read, write, and comment actions. These types are used directly in API requests and responses to ensure correct data exchange with the service.

This module implements direct interactions with the HackMD API version 1, offering functions to authenticate via tokens and perform CRUD operations on notes, both in personal and team contexts. It operates on structured types representing users, teams, notes, and permissions, enabling concrete actions like fetching a user's note list, retrieving full note details, or updating team notes. Specific use cases include creating a new note in a team workspace, fetching a user's teams, or deleting a note by ID.

This module provides direct access to the HackMD API version 1, enabling authentication via API tokens and performing CRUD operations on notes within personal and team contexts. It works with structured types representing users, teams, notes, and permissions, allowing concrete actions such as creating a note in a team workspace, fetching a user's list of notes or teams, retrieving full note details, and deleting or updating existing notes by ID. Specific use cases include automating note management in team workflows or integrating HackMD content into external applications.
